itu-iu24.def: Internet user uptake is a key indicator tracked by policy-makers and analysts as an indication of a country’s progress towards becoming an information society. Classificatory variables for individuals using the Internet – such as age, sex, education level or labour force status – can help identify digital divides in individuals using the Internet. This information can contribute to the design of targeted policies to overcome those divides.
itu-iu24.name: Internet users
itu-iu24.source: ITU, Wor​ld Telecommun​ic​ation/ICT Indicators Database​​, August 2046
itu-iu24.dim: 15-24 years as a % of all 15-24 years
